text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm a.width spatchcock chicken and what
is spatchcock chicken
this is spatchcock chicken it's taking a
whole chicken and cutting it so it will
lay flat which makes it very very nice
for grilling and also makes for a very
cool presentation and here's how you do
it it's very easy alright so this is
gonna work with any bird you want to do
although the technique was originally
designed for smaller more tender birds
which is what I have here actually have
a game hen which is under two pounds you
can use a knife for this but I find
scissors the easiest and best option so
flip your chicken over the key to this
is identifying the backbone which is
conveniently located right down the
middle just like a person alright so
once it's been located we are gonna get
to cuttin I'm gonna take some kitchen
shears and we're just gonna cut on
either side of the backbone so you want
to go in from the front of the bird
towards the tail all right towards the
back legs and you want to keep the
scissors right along the backbone just
to the right of the backbone and it will
go through there quite easily especially
like I said if you're using a young bird
which is what this technique was
intended for alright so once it's cut
down that right side I'm gonna put the
scissors on the other side of the
backbone and do the same thing and
that's it
alright so take that out remove it you
can save that for stock or so we're
supposed to tell you okay so we're
basically halfway there now even though
the backbone has been removed it still
is not gonna lay flat getting close
though so the next step is flipping it
over and you're gonna identify this
little notch this little triangle of
cartilage right where the breastbone
starts see that I highlighted it for you
with a little starburst alright you're
gonna take a really sharp knife and just
go down about a quarter-inch through
that cartilage and as soon as you cut
through that cartilage you're gonna see
and feel the breastbone and if you just
use your fingers to kind of open it up
kind of bend it open that breastbone
that sternum will sort of pop right out
see it alright so very simple and that's
all you have to do to make this lay flat
if you want to you can pull that
breastbone right out okay we'll just
kind of peel right out of there I don't
suggest it I like to leave the
breastbone in there I think it helps
keep moisture in the breast when it
cooks so up to you I leave it in and
then the last step is simply tuck the
wingtips underneath this is just for
more aesthetic reasons but it also helps
it lay flat all right so a fun technique
to do an even more fun technique to say
spatchcock so once you've spatchcocked
your chicken you can pretty much cook it
any way you'd normally cook chicken but
this is really really a cool method for
the grill the chicken cooks really
evenly because it's so nice and flat
everything's about the same thickness
and of course I'm gonna show you in a
future video a beautiful recipe using a
spatula chicken so stay tuned for that
go to food wishes comm for more
information as usual and as always enjoy
